name: FOXP2
description: Speech quirks, language genius, or silence — all tied to this.

name: DEC2
description: Some people sleep only 4 hours. Thank DEC2.

name: ELN
description: The trust-too-easily gene — missing this may explain Williams Syndrome.

name: OXTR
description: Oxytocin receptor gene — linked to bonding and trust behaviors.

name: MAOA
description: Sometimes nicknamed the ‘warrior gene’ due to links to aggression.

name: DRD4
description: Dopamine receptor gene linked to thrill-seeking and impulsivity.

name: ACTN3
description: The sprinter gene. Found in many elite athletes.

name: SERT
description: Your serotonin transporter — possibly shaping your mood baseline.

name: COMT
description: Affects emotional regulation and cognitive performance under stress.

name: BDNF
description: Supports learning and memory by helping brain plasticity.

name: ADRA2B
description: Linked to emotional memory — people may remember trauma more vividly.

name: CYP1A2
description: Determines how fast your body metabolizes caffeine.

name: ZFHX3
description: A rare gene linked to self-employment and non-conformity.

name: AVPR1A
description: Regulates social bonding, trust, and even monogamy.

name: CLOCK
description: Your circadian rhythm master gene — night owl or early bird?

name: FTO
description: Linked to appetite control and body weight regulation.

name: TPH2
description: Key gene for serotonin production. Influences emotional resilience.

name: HTR2A
description: A serotonin receptor gene — tied to psychedelic experiences.

name: ANKK1
description: Closely linked with dopamine regulation and novelty-seeking.

name: SLC6A4
description: Another serotonin transporter gene — influences anxiety sensitivity.

name: GABRA2
description: Linked to how your brain processes alcohol and social inhibition.

name: GRIN2B
description: Influences memory, focus, and emotional processing.
